reviews.review_msg: Prof was completely absent from class, taught entirely by TA. No lectures, just boring dry textbook that reads like an academic journal. Class made me not want to have a job in law enforcement. Felt like only reason we were in class was so we had to buy profs textbook so he could make money off of us. Not at all what I was expecting from this class

The prof was completely absent from the class, TA basically taught us. Textbook is horribly dry and boring, no lectures just the book. The exams have questions that weren't in readings or course content. It basically feels like you are only taking this class to buy his textbook so he can make money from you. Overall, very boring and dry class.

This class was a drag and not at all what I was expecting. Extremely dry and boring content, lack of lectures or any interaction with the prof. Class was run by the TA who was a hard marker, the prof was completely absent. Exam had typos, was thrown together last minute, and had questions that were not even mentioned in textbook or readings. Avoid.

I was a former honours student with Dr. Parent a few years back, and he was a no nonsense and fair advisor who helped kickstart my project when I didn't really know what topic to go on. Always willing to lend a hand to help his students succeed, but they need to reach out first.

Course load is easy to handle; presentation, paper, exam, and final. Go to lecture and take notes cause there is no way to access anything online, no canvas page. Get the textbook and take note on what he focuses on in lecture and memorize basically. He is really easy to talk to and has a guest speaker almost every lecture; lots of opportunity!

As a person Rick is an interesting person I enjoyed listening to his lectures, but his tests have absolutely nothing to do with anything lecture related. His test questions seem like they are random stuff he would know because he used to be a cop but nothing he actually taught us. No canvas page was annoying cuz we were never given any marks back.

I like Dr. Parent as a person, but I don't regard him highly as a professor. I'm not someone who thinks memorizing a textbook passes for an education. The textbook is awful. The midterm exam is worth 35%, while the final is also worth 35%. So that's 70% based on exams. The questions on the exams are random (so memorize everything!)

I have taken all courses offered by Rick. And from my experience, he is the best professor I had at SFU. His course involves presentation and paper based on presentation, participation, midterm and final. You really need the textbook as his exams are based on the book. He makes a lot of good jokes and guest speaker with his experience as ex-police.

He is an awesome prof however he makes it seem that the class will be extremely easy but when the midterm/final comes its the total opposite. Throughout the year he will say certain things will be on the exam, which are normally not.. If you take good lecture notes and textbook notes, you should be good!

By far one of the best classes I have ever taken at SFU. Amazing guest speakers almost every week and an incredible wealth of knowledge for those looking for a career in the criminal justice field. Show up to class and pay attention and you will do well and get lots out of it!

Rick is great and caring prof. His exams are a bit tough but if you study hard then you will do just fine.  He is VERY approachable and is always happy to help students. He would often crack jokes to keep things interesting. He would provide students info on how to apply for jobs in law enforcement. Also his cop stories are hilarious.

Great guy, extremely knowledgable in policing. Great guest speakers (at least one every week from different departments). Tough marker though. He doesn't really lecture, however, since classes are made up of guest speakers and student presentations. So make sure you read and know the textbook inside and out since you wont have lecture notes
Rick is a great prof! Just make sure you do the readings and be in class. He's interesting though, so you won't fall asleep!

The MC section of his exams are fairly doable if you read the textbook. The written part of the exam is what kills ya. He has so many guest speakers throughout the semester and assigns a bunch of random articles as well. Make sure you know every little thing because chances are he will probably ask you it on the exam.
Don't take his course

Other than the few odd slides in lecture, might as well just study the book because his midterms and finals are just that. Although he can be funny, he tends to just skip over dozens of slides because they're "in the textbook". It's his job to teach it...so I don't know, go figure.

Great class, his exams are very easy if you read the book and attend class regularly! Rick goes above and beyond for all of his students more than any other professor. I highly recommend taking his courses! If you work hard, you will do well.
Quality guy, he's funny and knows what he's talking about. However, he goes through lecture slides wayyy to fast

Funny, interesting, and intelligent guy, however, not cut out to be a professor. Some people do well in his class while others not so much. You either like or hate this guy. A very interested, animated individual who has a lot of passion for what he does. Great guy nonetheless.

Rick's a great prof..i dont know what people are talking about for CRIM 251 that the exams are random etc....the exams are straight from the textbook...word for word. If you study, you'll do great. He makes class fun and interesting, has quest speakers come in...i think he's great.

Rick's a GREAT prof once you get to the 300 level courses. I had the same complaints when he was teaching me 251, but trust me, it gets better. Also, one of the best lecturer's I know. Keeps it informal and gives relevant hints to what is on the exams. If you've declared your major and are in 3rd year, take his class. I can't recommend him enough.

Exams are completely random. Studied hard but some of the questions were asking about such small, insignificant things that were barely touched on in class. He is nice, funny guy, but not a great teacher overall.
He is humorous and nice so i liked him. His lectures are based on the textbook and also found midterm fair. But the problem was Final...very difficult and seemed irrelevant from what we learned.

His lectures are straight from the book. He adds in extra stories from his time in the police force, which makes the lecture interesting but irrelevant. He goes through the slides really fast, so you don't get time to copy. The tutorials are great though; it allows for a lot of interesting discussions. His 20 pg journal assignment is over-the-top.

His notes are dreadful, countless pages of information, and once you're about to write them down, he skips to the next slide. Tests? Fair, but he'll always say, and I quote "you might wanna copy this down because it will be on the test" and when you do, it's nowhere to be found All in all, a real dopey guy, he's a cop, not a teacher. Try to avoid.

Easy exams/subjective-random marker/useless!Has no conception of academia, only knows policing.I did a prez in tutorial, the TA was the marker.She said I did AWESOME!I got only 11/15 (crap). Y? The TA told me Rick decides on the final prez grade. How does he decide w/o witnessing my presentation? This guy should not teach another day.
HORRIBLE CLASS. HORRIBLE PROF, GOOD GUY BUT SHOULD QUIT TEACHING... STAY AWAY FROM THIS COURSE CAUSE IT WILL JUST BRING YOU DOWN!
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. This guy is an unorganized fool that is about as helpful as a door knob.

Decent prof with easy marking scheme. Exams are very easy. It can be a total GPA booster if you work hard. Very fun, amusing, informative and enjoyable in lecture with lots of experience. Does not make the class boring at all. RECOMMENDED!

He's not a bad dude, but this class just had zero structure. He had a lot more material than he could cover in class, and it resulted in him making very brief comments about each slide, rendering these comments virtually useless. In addition, his written questions were based on stuff that had very little to do with the course material. Stay away.

Crim 251. Worst teacher ever. spend days reading his book and his lecture. NON of that was on the test, i dont even know where he got the questions from. It wasnt just me who agreed with that. Hes a fun interesting teacher with lots of guest speakers. I suggest you avoid it at all costs, your GPA will take a major hit

Funny and interesting prof. Very straightforward, with effort, this class can be very easy. Made a boring subject like the CJS interesting. Must pay attention to his lectures and not his PPT, read from the textbook and you should be good to go on the MT and finals. Journals are quite tedious, but simple. Overall, I recommend Rick for CRIM 131

Class is easy. Prof seems easy going and the marking of the class is pretty basic. Midterm and final worth 30% each, 15% for journals, 15% for presentation in tutorial and 10% participation. Here's the kick, there's no notes available, prof says you're doing well don't worry....you should worry. Marking scale is messed up.

He is a funny guy but his marking schemes are something else. His lectures are very clear but his exams themselves are overly tricky. He says no one will fail his class but the midterm median was 18/30 and he didn't scale. The final was just as bad and a lot of people did very badly and he had no intentions to scale. (We can't all be that stupid)

Rick is one of my fav profs! He has so much knowledge about policing and is very approachable. His lectures are fun since he cracks jokes about every 2 mins and has cool guest speakers. His tests are a bit tricky, some of the MC were very detailed. You must read the text and attend lectures!

This guy's a strate up G!!! the funnest prof ever... made otherwise lame material enjoyable to learn.... really recommend him.... but a word of advice: really pay attention to wut he says and not as much as to wuts on the ppt, the ppt is all from the book and he uses the crap he says between jokes on exams

Best prof for policing.  Very knowledgeable, lots of experience and very funny.  Tells great stories and doesn't sugar coat policing like many recruiters.  If your interested in policing or how it works great class and prof to take.  Work load is decent and he is very fair.
Funny guy until I saw my final grade.. hahaha what a joke of a terrible grade. Don't take him, go to a comedy show instead and save your GPA

consists of a 30% individual Presentation/Paper, 10%  Participation, 30% Midterm, 30% Final...Rick is hilarious, makes class interesting.  HE LOVES JOKES  WIll tell jokes about his days as a officer and can relate well to students, would recommend this prof although his midterm can be hard but he goes out of his way to make sure no one will fail.
